originalText.text: Our agency has been working with the EYMT team for the last two years and we are constantly impressed with their approach to therapy. Alyssa has built an incredible team of therapists who are compassionate, knowledgable, professional, and caring - the perfect blend for therapy. They are always incredibly responsive to emails and take the time to provide thorough and detailed content. I can absolutely see why there are so many other positive reviews for this team, and would recommend any young adult to schedule an intake session!

originalText.text:
Pretty poor experience. I am surprised they operate this way when they are in this industry. It’s actually shocking. I’ve spoken to other therapists (my friends) and they are also surprised. I worked with Paula, and she is a very sweet person however I don’t think she is ready to be a therapist. Luckily I’m not in a crisis situation, but if a patient is, you need to be reliable and responsible. This is just not any job. A therapist actually has a huge responsibility because people are counting on you to help them.

We only had a few sessions, so we didn’t work together for a long time, but she canceled almost every time (in person visits). But regardless It was very unusual. One time we rescheduled for a virtual session and I waited for 15 min and she never showed up. She texted me a few hours later apologizing because she did not wake up in time for our 11am appt, that her alarm clocks didn’t go off. I gave her one more chance and we were supposed to meet the regular scheduled appt in person and she again last minute cancelled (but not being sick this time), she instead lost her metro card so she can’t make it. There are so many ways to get somewhere, like using your credit card, taking a Uber, taking a bike etc. So this excuse was weird and unprofessional, I was done. I didn’t want to work with someone like this. Also I specifically said I do not like therapy sessions to run a certain way, and I was so hopeful she listened. But she did not, and instead ran sessions the exact way I asked her not to which was my first red flag actually. Again I was sad because I liked her and the sessions besides that matter, were okay.

FYI I found another therapist at a Luminous therapy and am very happy now (for anyone unhappy here and looking for other options)!

originalText.text: My daughter has been through several counselors and therapists over the past two years. When we came across EYMT the professionalism and dedication was apparent from the start! My teen is finally happy to attend her weekly sessions and feels supported by her therapist! My husband and I have noticed a remarkable change in her behaviors and look forward to seeing more progress this year! If you are looking for someone that is passionate about what they do and can make a difference in your life or your child’s life, they will connect you to the right person!!!! I highly recommend them!! Thank you!!!!!!!

originalText.text: It was difficult to have a consistent positive experience with this company, at first it felt like everything was going to go good and actually was heading in the right track. But soon inconsistent patterns would appear like multiple cancellations during when I’m in crisis. To be told you’re not seen as a ‘high risk’ patient can be pretty difficult to hear in general but let alone in vulnerable times and to not even be called from the client care coordinator when your therapist is going on emergency medical leave but to just receive an automated sounding email to reschedule with a new therapist who also doesn’t care to reach out to confirm further information and set up link’s for the video chat or to meet via phone etc, Just feel’s wrong and like you’re not important. My 2 stars are still for Paula and the work we’ve achieved together and what I’ve learned but this company needs a lot more experience in multiple fields. I don’t recommend this company if you are looking for experienced therapists who have been working in the field for a good amount of time

originalText.text:
Alyssa is a caring therapist who challenges clients while still showing empathy and creating safe space to be heard. Her knowledge of DBT
that she provides clients and also in her groups, are helpful for anyone having trouble with regulating their own emotions. Her practice as whole is very welcoming and focuses on clients needs
